histogram.name: Tutorial.TabGroup.EditedTitle
histogram.summary: Records whether the user edited the tab group title during the Tab Groups tutorial. During one of the steps, the tutorial asks the user to name the new group, but the tutorial will continue if they dismiss the bubble without adding a name. We want to know if people follow the instruction or not.

histogram.name: Tutorial{TutorialID}.AbortStep
histogram.summary: When {TutorialID} is aborted, the step at which the tutorial was aborted. Only logged on desktop platforms. Logged each time a tutorial is aborted.

histogram.name: Tutorial{TutorialID}.Completion
histogram.summary: When {TutorialID} is ended, whether the tutorial was completed or aborted. Only logged on desktop platforms. Logged each time a tutorial is ended.

histogram.name: Tutorial{TutorialID}.IPHLinkClicked
histogram.summary: When {TutorialID} button is shown from an IPHLink, whether the user clicks to start the tutorial. Only logged on desktop platforms when the user either clicks or dismisses the FeaturePromo.

histogram.name: Tutorial{TutorialID}.StartedFromWhatsNewPage
histogram.summary: The count of successful starts of the tutorial when {TutorialID} button is clicked on the whats new page (called by the Tutorial BrowserCommand). A false value correlates to a failure to start the tutorial.

histogram.name: UserEducation.MessageNotShown
histogram.summary: Records what failure prevented an In-Product Help from being shown to the user. The failure defines the state of the User Education system, which can be many varieties (e.g. snoozed, disabled blocked by another promo, etc.).

histogram.name: UserEducation.MessageShown.RotatingPromoIndex
histogram.summary: Record the index of a rotating promo when it is shown to the user. This can be used to determine how deep in the rotation of rotating promos users are going, and also what proportion of users have seen a particular promo from a rotating promo set.

histogram.name: UserEducation.MessageShown.Subtype
histogram.summary: Records what subtype of In-Product Help was shown to the user. The subtype dictates special rules for when it can be shown. It can be normal, per-app (shown once each in multiple applications), or a legal notice (must be shown until explicitly acknowledged by the user).

histogram.name: UserEducation.MessageShown.Type
histogram.summary: Records what type of In-Product Help was shown to the user. The type defines the behavior of the IPH, which can be many varieties (e.g. toast, snooze, custom action, etc.).

histogram.name: UserEducation.NewBadge.{NewBadgeFeature}.MaxShownReached
histogram.summary: Recorded when a "New" Badge is shown. Recorded as "Completed" if the maximum number of shows has been reached and the badge will not show again for this user, otherwise recorded as "Not Completed".

histogram.name: UserEducation.NewBadge.{NewBadgeFeature}.MaxUsedReached
histogram.summary: Recorded when the feature promoted by a "New" Badge is used, typically via entry point promoted by the badge. Recorded as "Completed" if the maximum number of uses has been reached and the badge will not show again for this user, otherwise recorded as "Not Completed".

histogram.name: UserEducation.Session.ActivePeriodDuration.Min.Under1Hour
histogram.summary: Records the time duration of the Active Period of a User Education Session. The timer starts when a session starts. The timer is stopped and recorded when the current session is ended. Resolution is in minutes and the maximum time recorded in this metric is 1 hour.

histogram.name: UserEducation.Session.ActivePeriodDuration.Min.Under24Hours
histogram.summary: Records the time duration of the Active Period of a User Education Session. The timer starts when a session starts. The timer is stopped and recorded when the current session is ended. Resolution is in minutes and the maximum time recorded in this metric is 24 hours.

histogram.name: UserEducation.Session.IdlePeriodDuration.Hr.Under28Days
histogram.summary: Records the time duration of the Idle Period of a User Education Session. The timer starts when a session ends. The timer is stopped and recorded when a new session is started. Resolution in in hours and the maximum time recorded in this metric is 28 days.

histogram.name: UserEducation.Session.IdlePeriodDuration.Min.Under24Hours
histogram.summary: Records the time duration of the Idle Period of a User Education Session. The timer starts when a session ends. The timer is stopped and recorded when a new session is started. Resolution is in minutes and the maximum time recorded in this metric is 24 hours.

histogram.name: UserEducation.Session.LongTermCount
histogram.summary: When a new User Education session starts, records the number of recent sessions in the "long-term" window, which is 28 days. This helps us understand how frequently new sessions are triggered.

histogram.name: UserEducation.Session.MonthlyActiveDays
histogram.summary: When a new User Education session starts, records the number of days with at least one session in the past month. This helps us understand how frequently our product is being used in alignment with standard Google user segmentation metrics.

histogram.name: UserEducation.Session.RecentActiveDays
histogram.summary: When a new User Education session starts, records the number of days with at least one session in the past week. This helps us understand how frequently our product is being used in alignment with standard Google user segmentation metrics.

histogram.name: UserEducation.Session.RecentActiveWeeks
histogram.summary: When a new User Education session starts, records the number of weeks with at least one session in the past month. This helps us understand how frequently our product is being used in alignment with standard Google user segmentation metrics.

histogram.name: UserEducation.Session.RecentSuperActiveWeeks
histogram.summary: When a new User Education session starts, records the number of weeks with at least four active days in the past month. This helps us understand how frequently our product is being used in alignment with standard Google user segmentation metrics.

histogram.name: UserEducation.Session.ShortTermCount
histogram.summary: When a new User Education session starts, records the number of recent sessions in the "short-term" window, which is 7 days. This helps us understand how frequently new sessions are triggered.
